definition: to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
surname Ma
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: If you park on those yellow lines, you are really asking for it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把車停在黃線上，你就真是自找麻煩了。

sentences.english: You're just looking for trouble if you bring it to his attention.
sentences.chinese: 你讓他注意到這件事純粹就是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Don't trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
sentences.chinese: 麻煩沒有來找你，別去自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Do this for lap after lap at a higher intensity and you're asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果這樣一圈圈地遊，那麼你是在自找麻煩。

sentences.english: If you climb moutains in fog, you're asking for trouble .
sentences.chinese: 如果你在霧中登山，那就是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: If you harm a hair of my daughter's head, you'll get yourself into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 你要是動我女兒一根毫毛，你可就自找麻煩了。

sentences.english: That's what gets them into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 那樣他們就算自找麻煩了。

sentences.english: Do not get involved with politics. That'sborrowing trouble.
sentences.chinese: 不要涉足政界，那簡直是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: If you drive so fast in the speed-limited area, you will be asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在限速區開快車，你可是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: You're letting yourself in for trouble by buying that rusty old car.
sentences.chinese: 你買那輛生了的舊汽車是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: When you tamper with this position, you are asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 若是你損害了這一定位，那麼你就是在自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Mr. archibald did not give himself the trouble of making many remonstrances.
sentences.chinese: 阿奇博爾德先生似乎不想自找麻煩多方規勸。

definition: to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to play deaf-mute
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
red in the face/extremely angry
to look for trouble
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
to force someone to do something
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to sign/to make one's mark
written polemics
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
